title: Jessica Andrews wins Portico Prize for novel about female 'poetry and power'
description: Jessica Andrews' Saltwater wins the Portico Prize, for books that "evoke the spirit of the north".

title: What does Trump actually believe on climate change?
description: He has called it all of these things: "mythical", "a hoax", not a hoax, and "a very serious subject".

title: Stockton earthquake: How many quakes happen in the UK?
description: A minor earthquake has hit Teesside, but how serious can such events be?

title: Are packages safe, and other questions answered
description: Are packages bought from Wuhan safe? And is there a reason such viruses are emerging more from China?

title: Scotland fly-half Russell could miss Six Nations through injury
description: Scotland's Six Nations hopes suffer a savage setback after it emerges that influential Finn Russell is expected to miss the whole campaign.

title: World War Two veteran Anne Robson dies aged 108
description: Tributes are paid to the "fiercely independent" Anne Robson who was described as a "very inspiring".

title: Mount Vesuvius eruption: Extreme heat 'turned man's brain to glass'
description: Experts say the man's brain, found in the Roman town of Herculaneum, was affected by extreme heat.

title: Auschwitz: Prince Charles to warn world leaders over 'hatred'
description: On a visit to Israel, he will tell US, Russian and French leaders of the lessons of the Holocaust.

title: John Bercow: Formal complaint lodged against former Commons Speaker
description: Accusations against the ex-Speaker by one of his most senior advisers are thought to centre around bullying.

title: Myanmar Rohingya: World court orders prevention of genocide
description: The decision comes despite Myanmar de facto leader Aung San Suu Kyi's defence arguments.

title: Ben Garland: Ibiza search for biker who went missing in storm
description: The 25-year-old British man's motorbike has been found, but he remains missing.

title: Crime: Number of suspects charged by police hits new low
description: Only 7.3% of offences lead to a suspect being charged, figures show, as knife crime continues to rise.

title: China coronavirus: Wuhan and Huanggang on lockdown
description: There are more than 500 confirmed cases of the virus, which has also spread abroad.

title: East Kent hospitals: Baby death parents’ heartbreak over errors
description: At least seven babies have died since 2016 at one of the largest hospital groups in England, the BBC finds.

title: Zion Williamson NBA debut: San Antonio Spurs 121-117 New Orleans Pelicans
description: Watch Zion Williamson score 17 straight fourth-quarter points in his NBA debut as the New Orleans Pelicans are beaten 121-117 by San Antonio Spurs.

title: Coronavirus: How do you quarantine a city - and does it work?
description: People in Wuhan are being stopped from leaving - but it may not prevent the virus from spreading.

title: British singles interest ends at Australian Open as Dart & Watson beaten
description: Harriet Dart and Heather Watson are both beaten by seeds as British interest in the Australian Open singles ends on day four.

title: Jessica Simpson reveals childhood sexual abuse
description: The singer reveals in her new book how a childhood incident led to a reliance on drugs and alcohol.

title: Jean-Paul Gaultier: Stars turn out for designer's final show
description: French fashion designer Jean-Paul Gaultier ends a 50-year career with his last couture runway show.

title: Australia fires: US crew dead in firefighting plane crash
description: Three people are dead after a large air tanker went down fighting bushfires in New South Wales.

title: 'I put his life story on a boot and thought he might cry'
description: "Kickasso" makes a special shoe for Juventus' Cristiano Ronaldo and explains how he designed footwear for David Beckham's son, Ashley Cole, Justin Timberlake and Odell Beckham Jr.

title: The Papers: Fears over deadly virus and 'sour' UK-US relations
description: Thursday's newspapers feature a range of stories, including the latest on the Chinese coronavirus.

title: Harry and Meghan: How much privacy can they expect in Canada?
description: The couple complained about media intrusion within hours of relocating to Vancouver, Canada.

title: Problem gambling: Why do some people become addicted?
description: Over half of Britons gambled in the past year, so why does it become a problem for some?

title: 'I helped convict the bishop who abused me'
description: Sexual abuse survivors tell of their grooming at the hands of Bishop Peter Ball.

title: Overdrafts: Why you shouldn't ignore that message from your bank about fees
description: Overdrafts are undergoing their biggest change in a generation and it could double your costs.

title: Tyson Fury: How Manchester fighter has built his following - and plans to break America
description: Few might have predicted the marketing success of Tyson Fury. Imagination, charisma, talent - and honesty. This is how he did it.

title: Can wearing masks stop the spread of viruses?
description: Surgical masks have been used to prevent illness in China for decades.

title: Auschwitz: How death camp became centre of Nazi Holocaust
description: It is 75 years since Soviet Union troops liberated Auschwitz - now marked as Holocaust Memorial Day.

title: Running and male suicide: ‘Running almost pushed me over the edge’
description: Mark used running to cope with his friend’s suicide. But it grew to take over his identity.

title: Lions and tigers escape circus for vast new home
description: Seventeen big cats rescued from Guatemalan circuses have moved to a South African wildlife sanctuary.

title: Ivory Coast is using plastic waste to build schools
description: The West African country has partnered with UNICEF to transform landfill waste into bricks for schools.

title: Three generations join Delhi women's citizenship sit-in
description: Thousands of women are camping out in a Delhi suburb in protest over a law they see as anti-Muslim.

title: My Money: 'I had to get tickets, it was a huge sum, $519!'
description: As part of a BBC blog series, Sunneva María Svövudóttir from Iceland shares what she spent this week.

title: 'I have to live on $1,175 a year'
description: Brazil's army of fruit workers speak of struggling with low pay and dangerous working conditions.

title: 'Toxic, embarrassing, worst squad in 30 years' - pundits and fans on Man Utd defeat
description: Manchester United's latest defeat has seen the atmosphere turn "toxic" at Old Trafford, says former midfielder Darren Fletcher.
